thread.title: ObamaCare replacement plan includes tax break for insurance CEOs | New York Post
thread.title_full: ObamaCare replacement plan includes tax break for insurance CEOs | New York Post

author: Carl Campanile
title: ObamaCare replacement plan includes tax break for insurance CEOs | New York Post

organizations.name: new york post the house republican

text:
The House Republican plan to revamp Obamacare would provide tax breaks for health care companies with highly-paid executives.
The Affordable Care Act allowed the companies to take deductions of salaries of up to $500,000.
But the House Health Care Reform Act of 2017 eliminates the cap beginning in 2018 — allowing health insurers to deduct the entire salaries of CEOs and other executives making millions of dollars a year.
For example, both Aetna CEO Mark Bertolini and Cigna CEO David Cordani make more than $15 million a year.
“Under the proposal, the limit on the deduction of a covered health insurance provider . . . no longer applies,” a summary prepared by the House Joint Committee on Taxation states.
The analysis estimates the tax break will cost the government $400 million from 2017-2026.
The tax sweetener was first reported by Buzzfeed .
